usefulItems: 6 individual ramekins, small serving bowl, refrigerator
title: Cinnamon Panna Cotta with Apple, Apricot and Ginger Compote

ingredients.content: 15 g ginger, fresh root, sliced in 2 mm "coins"
600 g Cox apples, peeled, quartered, cores removed

preparations.content: Place gelatine in a shallow bowl and cover with cold water to soften for 5 minutes. Continue with recipe while gelatine soaks.
Place sugar and cinnamon stick in mixing bowl. Grind <b>40 sec/speed 10<b>.
Add double cream and milk, heat <b>4 min 30 sec/80°C/speed 3<b>.

Squeeze excess water from softened gelatine, add gelatine to mixing bowl and mix until fully dissolved <b>30 sec/speed 4<b>. Pour into 6 individual ramekins and allow to cool 30 minutes before placing in refrigerator to set for 6 hours or overnight. Meanwhile clean mixing bowl and make the compote.
Place ginger into mixing bowl and chop <b>5 sec/speed 10<b>. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl then chop again <b>5 sec/speed 10<b>.
Add apricots and chop <b>4 sec/speed 6<b> then add Cox apples and sugar and chop <b>2 sec/speed 5<b>.
Add water and cook <b>12 min/90°C//speed 1<b> until apples are cooked but not puréed.
Add butter and lemon juice, mix <b>20 sec//speed 1<b>. Transfer compote to a small serving bowl and set aside to cool completely.

When ready to serve, run a knife around the insides of the ramekins then immerse ramekin bottoms in a shallow bowl of very hot water for 1 or 2 seconds to help loosen the panna cottas. Turn out panna cottas and serve with the compote.

hintsAndTricks: This compote is a perfect complement to the creaminess of the panna cotta, and would also work well served with yoghurt or porridge for breakfast.
Serve the panna cotta with a fruit coulis or a different fruit compote of your choice.
For a vanilla panna cotta, remove cinnamon in step 1 and add seeds of 1 vanilla pod in step 2.
This deliciously spiced autumnal dessert is good for a dinner party as it can be made ahead.
